page.title: 03VISIT TO HUCKNALL COLLIERY
page.content: On my visit to{Hucknall Colliery }we went past the count house and walked to the car park where a man called Glen met us and gave us a helmet to protect our heads. We went to the control room. There were two big TV screens with a picture of the coal underground so that they can see if there is an emergency and where it is. Next we went to the shower room. There were a lot of showers and lockers and there was a shoe cleaner. Next we went to the wheel room where there was a big wheel. This big wheel is used to make the lifts go up and down the shafts. Then we went to the tip where they had planted grass and conifer trees. We were told that there are Christmas parties and trips to the seaside and there is a Welfare band, bowls and 2 football teams. By Gavin Paylor.
